Fields.DialogueText: Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
Good work out there, Theodor. That seems to be becoming a motif, don't you think?
Don't speak to me about narrative right now, Kapitän.
Is something the matter?
I've been going through a spell of writer's block lately. No matter how hard I try, I just can't seem to come up with anything fresh.
I can't pinpoint an exact time, but it's been going on long enough that it has become quite the nuisance.
Can you crawl inside my head and massage my brain?

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever had this problem before?

Fields.DialogueText: Never! I've always been fairly proud of the fact I've avoided this disease which seems to infect all writers.
Maybe you just need some inspiration.
Inspiration?
We'll be docking soon in a nearby port town. Let's stretch our legs and see the sights. It's hard to be inspired by an endless expanse of ocean, after all.
Ja! Okay, Kapitän, I'll let you take me out!
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
This town is lovely, isn't it? Even if we're only able to walk around this little stretch of it.
The view from here is good enough for me - and the town *is* lovely. Almost as if it exists outside the war even.
Any images coming to mind?
Of what, exactly?
I don't know, damsels in distress, big bad wolves, that kind of thing.
I'm afraid not.
I see...
That isn't to say I'm not having a good time! It truly is lovely here. I'd like to come back after the war is over.

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything else you plan on doing.

Fields.DialogueText: Breathing a sigh of relief, mostly. Aside from that, seeing what the future holds for the world of cinema is definitely on my to-do list!
I never said that, did I?

Fields.MenuText: Let's do our best until then.

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed. Respites like this are only good when placed in between battles!
Let's head back to the ship. We should probably head out soon. Sorry this was a bust, Theodor.
On the contrary, it's always nice to go out with you like this.
Should we ask around for weapons we might be able to secure before we go?

Fields.MenuText: You'll rarely hear me say no to scrounging.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's just enjoy the sunset.
And the company.
Yeah. And the company.
That's just good Märchen logic, Kapitän. Never refuse gifts offered in good faith when you're on an adventure.
I like that you can still call it an adventure.
I like that *you* can still make it feel like one.
Theodor. How goes the writer's block?
Still nothing, I'm afraid.
Is that so?
I worry I may never be able to write anything ever again.
Hmm. Have you considered branching out? Expanding your horizons, so to speak?
I don't follow.
Well, you've been writing children's fairy tales for so long. Have you ever tried writing something more adult?
The Brother's Grimm can get pretty adult, I think you'll find.
Not like that. Something more... character-driven. Like a romance, perhaps.
Romance, you say.

Fields.MenuText: A story about people and no otherworldly elements.

Fields.DialogueText: And you think children would find that interesting? I suppose that's what you're trying to tell me, isn't it? It wouldn't be written for children.
Just think about it.
Is this some kind of trick to get me to write you smut?
I see.
Ja. I'll give it some thought. Thank you for the advice.
*sigh*
This is ridiculous. I shouldn't feel so much pressure to eat my food in a hurry. The Morganas can't possibly show up *every* time I'm-
*ALARM*
That was a test, you evil-
@BATTLE
Kapitän, are you busy right now?
Not particularly. What's on your mind?
I had a go at writing a small short story in the mode you suggested.
And you want me to take a look?
Precisely.
It's no honour. If you build it up so much, it will never live up to your expectations.
I'd rather you just read it...

Fields.MenuText: What broke you out of your funk?

Fields.DialogueText: After I took your advice, I started writing and just couldn't stop.
Well, leave it with me and I'll let you know when I'm done.
Danke!
@BATTLE
Ah, there you are, Theodor. I finished your short story.
You did? Do I dare ask?
Well, I was really enjoying it.
"Was?"
I was wondering if you could explain this section to me. Right before the pair are about to kiss?
Uh-huh.
"The young girl closed her eyes and leaned in. Her lips pursed at the thought of what was to come..."
Mhmm.
"But then, from the mist, a wolf leapt out from behind the foliage and devoured them both!"
Chilling, right?!
You think a witch would have been more appropriate?

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you've quite grasped the point of the exercise.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?
What's romance without a little drama!
*ALARM*
Let's deal with the Morganas and then perhaps I can give you some... constructive feedback...
@BATTLE
So, Kapitän, you had some constructive criticism?
Right. I think you're still thinking about this in a more fantastical way than I'd expected.
I see...
Not that there's anything wrong with that. But, if you really want to try something new, I don't think this is the way to go about it.
What do you suggest?
How about a short story about two people that meet each other for the first time?
And no folktale motifs? No magic?
I'll try my best.

Fields.MenuText: If you try this for me, there might be something in it for you.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't need to go that far, I asked YOU for help, after all. Although, if you do insist, I won't say no...
*ALARM*
After handling the Morganas, I'll leave you to take a shot at it.
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Kapitän?
We have a new mission, Theodor. You'll have to put a pause on the writing for now.
Jawohl.
Morganas. A lot of them.
En route?
About to mobilize. Command's marked a scout ship we think is gathering info before the main fleet moves in. We tracked its route and we're to deal with the majority of them before they make a move.
It's been a while since we were out in the field.

Fields.MenuText: Trust me. You haven't lost your touch.

Fields.DialogueText: I could never!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe this could prove for some good inspiration.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you wanted me to move AWAY from these kinds of scenarios.

Fields.MenuText: What's the worst that could happen?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't tempt fate!
*ALARM*
Looks like we'll have a chance to warm up. With me!
@BATTLE
Not *that* long.
But I still feel strangely out of practice for a major operation...
Hey...
Still hard at work on the new book, I see.
After what you said, I got to thinking, and I've dived a little deeper into it now.
So, you have some characters for me?
A couple, yes.
And, do they have names?
Well, I decided to draw on real life, as you told me.
So...
Theo and Kappi...
Uh-huh...
Usually I'm great at coming up with interesting characters, but I hit another wall! You and I are the only people I could think of!
Please don't!

Fields.MenuText: So, they are based on us.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, the names at least.
I haven't decided yet. Let's see how things go.
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
We have some time before we reach the Morgana fleet. I hope you can get it finished before then.
Right... We could perish in the upcoming battle after all.
Actually, I thought it would make for a nice victory read.
Oh, of course! This writer's block is really messing with my morale.
I'll leave you to it.
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
Kapitän, are you busy?
Never too busy for you. What do you need?
I wanted some advice.
With regards to your book?
Ja. I'm struggling to write a compelling romance. I've never been in love, so I don't really know how to write about it.
At least, I don't think so...
It's hard to draw on real life experiences when you haven't had any.

Fields.MenuText: And you came to me? Am I such a Casanova?

Fields.DialogueText: I had limited options...
Hm... Maybe we should go on a date?
Kapitän?!
Purely for educational purposes! It wouldn't be real. Just so you can get a feel for what the atmosphere is like.
I see. Okay, under those circumstances I think it would be fine.
Meet me in my quarters when you have some time. I'll get everything ready.
K-Kapitän... I'm here...
Please, come in and take a seat.
You prepared all this food for me?
I did. Here, let me get that chair for you. It's customary, isn't it...?
Is that so...? Then, I'll oblige...

Fields.MenuText: Try not to be so stiff.

Fields.DialogueText: You're one to talk.
I'm here, aren't I? I wouldn't have come if I was against the idea.
Whatever you're having...
This is nice.
What normal things do people do on dates?
Well, we usually try and get to know more about the other person.
You've been on a lot of dates, have you...?
I've seen a lot of movies...
Haha, how about we let the mood take us naturally?
Sounds good!
*ALARM*
Nixen!
Hey, I asked YOU out, remember. Picking up the Morgana check is the least I can do!
We'll split it!
@BATTLE
I have to say, that meal was positively divine.
It's my homemade recipe, you know?
Well, I could consider marrying into a family with such great cooking skill.
Marrying?
We... are still role playing, right?
Of course.
So, what comes after the date is finished?

Fields.MenuText: Depends if it's the first date or the third.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? Why, what happens usually after three--Kapitän! Your face is as red as a beet!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not as experienced as you think I am.

Fields.DialogueText: So, we're both in the dark.

Fields.MenuText: Normally, we'd pay and leave the restaurant.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that your way of kicking me out?
I thought we agreed to let the mood dictate our decisions.
Right. So, what is the mood telling you to do right now...?
Ja...
Maybe, we could...
Ja...
A goodnight...
*ALARM*
*Sigh* As a writer, even I think that's a little cliché...
It can't be helped. Thank you for a lovely evening, Theodor. Let's end this date with a bang!
Not like that!
@BATTLE
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
Mind if I join you, Theodor?
By all means.
I'll try not to disturb your writing.
Actually, I just finished up the first chapter.
Mind if I take a look?
Actually, I'd rather you wait until the whole thing is finished.

Fields.MenuText: Keeping me in suspense, I see.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd rather you have the whole picture instead of just a taste.
Not really.
Don't worry, I'll finish it up sooner rather than later.
I'm happy to sit here and eat my meal in peace while you write.
Don't think you're being a nuisance. It's nice to have the company.
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
Kapitän, I had another question if it isn't too much trouble.
Maybe another time.
That's what I was counting on!

Fields.MenuText: I'm really not the romantic you think I am.

Fields.DialogueText: That isn't true! Your date was wonderful...
Go on, then.
It's about heartbreak.
Heartbreak?
No story is good without drama, and I feel it necessary to include some kind of tension.
Tension, huh? Let's discuss this more over a meal. Meet me in the mess hall.
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
Can you imagine the worst thing in the world?
War, no doubt.
Well, yes, but how about something a little more personal?
In that case, not really.
Okay. Try to imagine something you care about deeply.
Ja, I have something.
Now, imagine if that thing was taken away from you our of spite, never to be returned. How would that make you feel?
Bad.
Is this some kind of literary exercise?

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you supposed to have a way with words?

Fields.DialogueText: When I'm writing, yes, but I'm not "on" all the time.
Were you looking for something more?
I know how to write about loss and discomfort, just not heartbreak specifically.
I have an idea. Wait for me in my quarters.
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
Theodor.
Kapitän, it's good to--
Take a seat.
Huh? Oh... ja...
You're probably wondering why I called you in here.
(Kapitän is being extra stern. I wonder if this is some facade to cut ties with me so I can experience a pseudo-heartbreak. I better play along).
I'm not happy, Theodor.
Oh, why ever not, Kapitän? Does this have anything to do with me by any chance?
No.
Well, in that case-- wait... no?
I can't do this anymore. I can't be a captain.
Wait, this is real?! Is this some kind of midlife crisis?!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not that old, am I?

Fields.DialogueText: This is no time for jokes!
Retiring?!

Fields.MenuText: I guess that's what you could call it.

Fields.DialogueText: But...! I don't understand!
I shouldn't have said anything. I'll go.
Nein! You stay right there! Now, listen to me, this is not the time to be--!
Okay, okay, I think you've had enough.
Whu-- Explain!
Of course. Let me just grab something to wipe these tears away.
Explain yourself!
Right. Well, in my opinion, heartbreak isn't all about losing what you love.
Ja?
Having your expectations shattered will also provide a satisfactory simulation of the feeling, right?
So, seeing you so depressed...
It made you sad too, right? And it's the same with a breakup. Well, an amicable one at least. You still love that person, but they aren't who you thought they were.
Wow... well, I have to say you certainly subverted my expectations.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe I should be the writer.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't get ahead of yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Can I do anything to apologize? I feel I may have overstepped.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll DEFINITELY be in touch about that.
I suppose only time will tell.
*ALARM*
Promise me you'll never do anything like that again...
I promise.
@BATTLE
You're looking in much brighter spirits, Theo.
Ja, no thanks to you...
Come on, don't be that way. I'm sure you haven't been able to put your pen down thanks to me.
Well, that is certainly true. Although, at the moment, most of the ideas I have remain floating about my head. I'm struggling to find a way to ground them.

Fields.MenuText: Have you tried mind-mapping your thoughts?

Fields.DialogueText: I've always found mind-mapping to be a waste of time. I prefer to pour everything I have over a page and edit from there. The problem is, there's too much going on up there!
I didn't know you had such a penchant for spoilers. You'll know in due time, rest assured.
This is problem most writers go through, I'm afraid. The only cure I've ever seen in other great artists is intoxicants or depression. And, considering we've already tried the latter...
*ALARM*
Maybe a good fight will help get those gears whirring again! Let's move!
@BATTLE
We should be coming up on the enemy soon.
Yeah. Stay sharp.
There's a lot, right?

Fields.MenuText: Not yet. We'll likely see a smaller force on lookout first.

Fields.DialogueText: Then we'll take them down inconspiculously.
Did you forget who you are talking to?
Forever and always.
I spy the scout group. Let's take it out.
@BATTLE
Keep fighting!
I won't let up just--
*KABOOM*
Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Kapitän! Are you hurt?! Say something!
I know you are, I know.
Don't look at it, just keep your eyes on me.
Ja, Kapitän, ja! It's been felled, you don't have to worry.
I'm getting kind of tired...
Nein, Kapitän! Kapitän!
Kapitän! You're awake!
Theodor... What...
Don't speak, Kapitän. You cracked your head in that last battle and you passed out. Pupil dilation looks okay...

Fields.MenuText: I thought I was made of sterner stuff.

Fields.DialogueText: There's nothing to be ashamed about.
This is no time to be worried about me!

Fields.MenuText: And you nursed me back to health?

Fields.DialogueText: Still, this is pretty good inspiration for your story, right?
We've already covered heartbreak, don't you forget. This is just overkill...
Well now you get to write the "get-back together" happy ending.
Who said my story would have a happy ending?
Come on, anyone can write a sad ending where everyone died. Only true geniuses can write a satisfying good end.
Okay, I'll give it a shot. For you.
*ALARM*
Leave the Nixen to me. You get some rest.
@BATTLE
This will be the final stop before we come upon the Morgana fleet.
Are there any supplies you think we should pick up before we head out?

Fields.MenuText: No, I think we should be fine. I'm in top shape!

Fields.DialogueText: You did just get out of the infirmary, remember? Don't push yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Whatever you think we need. You have my blessing.

Fields.DialogueText: Leave it to me.
I'll wait back on the ship. Come and find me when preparations are complete.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: It's now or never. I have confidence in you and our loadout.

Fields.DialogueText: And I in you and yours. No refit necessary.
There, Kapitän! The fleet is on the horizon!
Aren't you the one in charge?!
I like your initiative!

Fields.MenuText: We never back down from a fight!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm right behind you!
This is it, Theodor! This is the climax you've been waiting for!
Right! My writer's block is standing before me in physical form! let's blow through them all!
@BATTLE
We did it, Kapitän. The fleet has been vanquished.
All thanks to you.
I can't take all the credit.

Fields.MenuText: You really had a fire lit under you!

Fields.DialogueText: Stop, you're embarrassing me...

Fields.MenuText: Did you get everything you needed?

Fields.DialogueText: I feel like a weight has been lifted. I'm ready to write!
If you insist...
Now then, get back and finish that book!
Jawohl!
Kapitän! I finished my book!
You did?! That's wonderful!
You're the first person I've told.
Right away!
Me too!
A little... To be honest.
I'll get started right now, then!
Good!
Uhh... Theodor?
What?! What happened?! Did you get to a good bit?!
I can't really read this with you looking over my shoulder.
*ALARM*
Handle the Morganas and I'll speed-read it.
@BATTLE
Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Feind im Anmarsch!
@BATTLE
I finished up the book, Theodor.
Oh, no, oh, dear... I've never been so nervous. What did you-- HM?!
There.
What are you doing?! In public! K-k-k--!
That's how your story ends, right? The dashing officer places a kiss on the fair lady.
That was just a story!
I suppose, but...
That means so much to me.
Kapitän...
I couldn't help but see myself in your characters. I've been wanting to do that for a long time.
You... Me too.
I love you, Theodor.
I love you too.
